sen.j: 小松 清直（こまつ きよなお、慶応2年9月18日 (旧暦)（1866年10月26日） - 大正7年（1918年）3月5日は、明治～大正の華族。
sen.e: Kiyonao KOMATSU (Oct. 26, 1866 to March 5, 1918) was a peer who lived between the Meiji and Taisho periods.

sen.j: 父は薩摩藩家老小松清廉、母は妾の三木琴。
sen.e: His father was Kiyokado KOMATSU, a chief retainer of Satsuma Domain, and his mother was Koto MIKI, a mistress of Kiyokado.

sen.j: 夫人は元薩摩藩家老島津久宝 (豊州家)の娘小松福子。
sen.e: His wife was Fukuko KOMATSU, a daughter of Hisataka SHIMAZU (Toyosu Family), a former chief retainer of Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 父・帯刀清廉と京都の芸妓・琴の長男として誕生する。
sen.e: He was born the first son to his father Tatewaki Kiyokado and Koto, a geigi (a woman who gives fun with a song, a dance or a music instrument at a feast) in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 帯刀は小松清廉のもう一つの下の名前のようで、一般には小松帯刀の名で知られている人物であり、帯刀は名字ではありません。

sen.j: 1870年8月に清廉が没したため、清廉正妻の小松千賀により鹿児島で養育された。
sen.e: Because Kiyokado passed away in August, 1870, he was brought up by Chika KOMATSU, a legal wife of Kiyokado, in Kagoshima.

sen.j: しかし、小松家には養子小松清緝（町田久成実弟で千賀の甥）がおり、家督は1870年3年10月に清緝が相続するも、1872年9月25日に清直が新たに相続した。
sen.e: However, Kiyotsugu KOMATSU (a nephew of Chika, and a real younger brother of Hisanari MACHIDA) had already been in the Komatsu Family, and Kiyotsugu succeeded to a property on March 10, 1870, but on September 25, 1872, Kiyonao newly inherited the family estate.

sen.j: 1896年6月に隠居し、1918年3月に52歳で死去。
sen.e: In June 1896, he went into retirement, and in March 1918, he passed away at the age of 52.

sen.e: His grave is located in a family plot of the Nejime and Komatsu Families in Hiyoshi Branch of Hioki City Hall in Kagoshima Prefecture (former Hiyoshi town public office).

sen.e: His eldest son, Tatewaki, was bestowed a title of count in consideration of his services in the Restoration, and served as a member of the House of Peers (Japan), but in March 1905, he passed away.
